channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report E-2025010110
item.description:
Report E-2025010110

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: YEMASSEE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 8, 2025, one (1) 1-gallon jug of UN3266 was punctured and released approximately one-half gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized soda ash, granular absorbents, and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025010106
item.description:
Report E-2025010106

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-13T21:12:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-07
  • City: YEMASSEE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 7, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1791 was damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools and absorbents to remove the product. The damaged drum was placed in one (1) 95-gallpn overpack and all waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.
